If you drive on public roads or highways where people are frequently present, you can do things like avoiding using your license plate, or making your car look similar to other vehicles (using stickers or whatever).  This is very likely to get you caught in the end though.  A good general rule of thumb is that if you don’t have some reason for evading the cameras, and the cameras are only set to issue warnings or get your license plate, they aren’t very likely to give you a ticket.  That said, people do get ticketed fairly frequently, even for large and obvious infractions.  With that said, there are a few general precautions to try: 

1) Driving below the speed limit.  This is the most common solution, as it’s cheap and easy and effective.  Drive at the speed limit.  Don’t even think about it! 

2) Be sure your vehicle’s details match.  Make sure you aren’t driving a vehicle that is known to be connected to a criminal activity.  This means using a stolen car or a vehicle that is known to be a “smash and grab”.  There is a lot of software available to check this on your phone
